1243.content:
Transporting the Key's essence (which transformed into Dawn) to the beginning of the Third Millennium the monks, being in such a desperate rush, neglected to fully stabilize Dawn's body in its current form. Being struck by the energy beam activated the EMERGENCY TRANSFORMATION element in her seemingly human heart. Designed for when the Key, "Dawn's body" was suddenly under attack by demonic energy, seconds after entering a place where she was alone, Dawn would transform into the image of the first female mammalian form that she focused on in her mind.

So depending on your point of view, it was either a good thing OR a bad thing that like many pre-teen American girls, Dawn had really,REALLY liked Hello Kitty. She had a fairly large collection of Hello Kitty and other stuffed animals sitting in the attic. Buffy had made her box them up shortly after their mother died. Buffy told Dawn, "You're now too old for such things and YOU'RE putting them ALL" in the attic. Which only served to further the strain between the sisters. Returning home exhausted, when Dawn fell asleep the only thing going through her head was how much she wished she could again be with her collection of stuffed animals, especially Hello Kitty and her other BIG CAT dolls.

When she fell asleep that night Dawn's desire manifested itself, transforming Dawn into an anatomically correct, full sized copy of her favorite stuffed Siberian Tiger doll. Of course, since Dawn at that time, still didn't know she was "a Key", she had absolutely no clue how to change herself back into her human form. In her panic Dawn accidentally re-activated the transformation spell AFTER Buffy had carried her into the attic. Wishing that she could at least move on her own, Dawn was pleasantly surprised when her body began moving under her control. So was Buffy, who froze right where she stood when Dawn started approaching her.

Once Dawn had realized she could walk again, she started walking as fast as she could towards Buffy. Incorrectly assuming that since she could now walk, she could now also talk Dawn began speaking to Buffy in a pleading almost crying voice. Saying over and over, "Buffy, it's me your sister Dawn. Help me get my human body back." All that Buffy could hear was, "Roar, Roar, Roar" so Dawn was quite startled when just as she's about to touch Buffy, Buffy let out with a blood-curdling scream. Which woke up Willow who promptly rolled right out of bed onto the cold, hard floor in her bedroom. The reason Buffy screamed was that the one thing in this or any World OR Dimension that the absolutely fearless Vampire Slayer was terrified of were stuffed animals! It all went back to a long, forgotten incident that occurred when Buffy was just 7 years old. It was during a time when her parents were still deeply in love and happily living together in Los Angeles.

Still very groggy and with a big throbbing knot on the back of her head, Willow set out to find the source of the scream that had woken her from a really, REALLY sexy dream involving her, Tara and some magical super-charging to their bedroom activities. By the time she had dragged herself down the hallway to the ladder leading to the attic Willow was in a very foul mood. Immediately after screaming, Buffy had started backing away from Dawn. Unfortunately for her, because she kept both eyes on Dawn, Buffy didn't notice where she was stepping so within seconds she stumbled falling backwards on the attic floor knocking herself out. When Willow poked her head into the attic all she saw was one of Dawn's stuffed animals out of its box. (Buffy couldn't be seen from the attic door.) Turning to leave Willow quickly turned back when Dawn started 'Roar' ing again, repeating what she had earlier said to Buffy. She didn't have any more luck with Willow than she had had with Buffy.

1243212.content:
Incorrectly assuming that Dawn had transformed into a stuffed tiger SOLELY due to her being hit by that demon's beam the previous night, Willow went searching for a cure that would reverse it's effects on Dawn. When she finally found a possible spell, Willow blithely ignored the tiny footnotes written at the bottom of the pages under the spell. She figured that they weren't applicable to Dawn's current condition. After all, it stated that it would only work IF only ONE form of magic was involved in the subjects transformation. Otherwise the author of the spell, "Couldn't be held responsible for the subject not completely AND SOLELY returning to its former SHAPE AND SIZE." Usually a spell is written solely on a single page in her book, but this one was spread across TWO (!) pages. Having never conjured up a spell written in that fashion before, Willow didn't know (but Tara did) that TWO witches were required to read the alternating lines from the separate pages for the spell to work correctly.

Since the spell-book stated that the return transformation wouldn't immediately occur, once she had finished her casting, Willow calmly went downstairs made some dinner for her and Buffy while they waited for Dawn to transform back into a 13-year old girl. Just as Willow finished cooking dinner, Tara arrived unexpectedly. Asking Willow, "Say Willow, did you find out anything more about that demon we all faced last night?" Willow replied in a strained voice, "Ya, you know we're all lucky that Dawn was the only one that was hit by that Demon's beam. Otherwise we would've been changed into stuffed animals like her." Tara then said, "You're kidding now, aren't you?" "Absolutely not, however if you want to see Dawn before she transforms back, you better dash up to the attic right now. I already said a counter-spell and Buffy's up there waiting for Dawn to change back. It should be happening any time now."

Since Tara was always interested in learning new spells, she asked Willow to show her the one she used. When Willow pointed it out to her Tara {a bit hurt} asked, "Willow who said the spell with you?" "What do you mean, who said it with me? I cast it ALL by myself." Tara then inquired, "Didn't you notice those tiny footnotes at the bottom of the page." "YA, so what." Willow shot back. "DO you or DON'T you want to see Dawn as a cute, cuddly, full-sized stuffed tiger before she changes back? Tara then said over her shoulder as she dashed upstairs, "I'm a whole lot more interested in seeing just how you managed to screw up THAT spell, Willow. Don't you even know that for a spell like that to work correctly TWO witches cast it simultaneously by alternately saying the sentences. Each witch speaking from ONLY one of the pages." Just then both witches hear steps coming down the hallway from the attic, Buffy at the top of her lungs screamed, WILLOW !!
1243212.title: Willow shouldn't have IGNORED the TINY footnotes.

12432121122.content:
Shortly after Dawn had let Willow get back up, Buffy and her were downstairs discussing this unexpected turn of events. For although Dawn was upstairs talking with Tara, Willow didn't know just how much improved Dawn's newly enhanced feline hearing had become. Because Dawn wasn't yet 14 and so still a virgin, Tara played a children's board game with her rather than a more adult activity.

After happily spending well over an hour with Tara, Dawn's stomach started purring from hunger. Moments later, Dawn had buckled over in pain, clutching her stomach and screaming at the top of her amplified lungs about her sudden intense hunger.

Tara yelled for Willow and Buffy to help her with Dawn. It was fortunate that while Buffy was now a full-grown panther her strength had tripled so it wasn't all that difficult for her to drag Dawn downstairs to her car. Of course, in her current condition she wasn't planning on going with them. Instead, Tara drove the 3 of them to the Sunnydale Mall parking near the entrance closest to the Food Court.

Willow dashed in to get a whole lot of take-out using her Witch Bank card with its magically unlimited credit line. Just as soon as Willow returned, Dawn tore into the food with wild abandon. It took 3 trips to finally sate Dawn's hunger. For the next month and a half at the same time every afternoon, like clockwork, Dawn's hunger returned. It grew a little more each day and after a few weeks Dawn had fully transitioned into a carnivore. As she started vomiting up her veggies, fruit and bread Willow quit buying it for her.

At the end of each meal, Dawn's stomach would protrude out as if she were just a little pregnant. As the weeks progressed, Dawn's belly grew larger and larger after her daily meal. The problem was while she ate until she was stuffed Dawn's hunger didn't entirely go away. It was always there in the back of her mind and in the pit of her stomach. Of course, with all the food she was consuming Dawn grew bigger all around.

On the 47th day after Dawn's original transformation, Glory showed up looking for her "KEY". It had only been a few days earlier when Willow, after long study and consultation finally returned Buffy her human body. Buffy was so happy she could again walk on 2 feet, she didn't complain about still having cat ears, a very fine coat of fur and a very fluffy 3 1/2 foot long tail. Glory's first look at Buffy got her laughing so hard she temporarily forgot about Dawn.

That didn't last long and soon she carried Dawn away. Arriving at the place where she intended to sacrifice Dawn to open the gateway to her home, Glory began the ritual. Catching up with her Buffy started fighting back with all of her enhanced strength. She quickly managed to slice off Glory's right hand just above the wrist. Tossing it in Dawn's direction, Dawn perked up saying, "Oh goody, Ladyfingers." What happened next was the most surprising sight Buffy would ever see in her life.

Unfortunately for Glory as Dawn munched away Glory screamed out in bloody murder from the pain of each of Dawn's crunching bites on her hand. Buffy and the others stood there absolutely stunned, when right after she finished eating Glory's hand Dawn leaped at Glory yelling at the top of her lungs, DINNER TIME!

In less than 10 minutes, the only evidence left that Glory had EVER existed, was the glowing blond hairballs Dawn had started coughing up. Saying, "Yum, yum that really hit the spot." the now enormous Dawn fell into a deep sleep that lasted over 2 1/2 days. Seconds later, finally snapping out of her trance Buffy leaped at Willow yelling, "Willow, I'm going to kill you for turning Dawn into a cannibal." As bad as she was, even Glory didn't deserve to be eatenALIVE !! Tara then yanked so hard on Buffy's tail she loosened her grip and Willow quickly poofed herself out of Buffy's sight. Turning her attention back to Dawn, Buffy decided to let sleeping Dawn's lie. She wasn't looking forward to talking to her now even more enormous "little" sister. Three days later and with still with no sign of Willow, Buffy finally confronted her sister after she had been awake for several hours.

Dawn was quite upset with Buffy for leaving her outside. It had been a rare slow moving late Spring thunderstorm that drenched Dawn while she slept giving her a really bad case of the sniffles. Not liking the expression on Dawn's face, Buffy warily approached her. Asking in a strangely quiet voice for her Buffy said, 'Uh, Dawn do you know what happened before you fell asleep?" Dawn happily said, "Of course I do, Buffy. I ate Glory and boy was she ever delicious. It's too bad there isn't another one of her around. She really hit the spot. And you know what else Buffy. That hunger I've had in the pit of my stomach since becoming a tiger-girl is all gone now. You've got to admit I sure found a different way to get rid of her. Oh, and Buffy if you don't let me go demon hunting with you now, I'll do the same to you."

1243212112212.content:
Now weighing over a quarter ton and topping out at a little under 8 feet tall, Dawn Summers was truly a spectacular sight to behold. She was in fact such a sight that since her transformation, Buffy had done everything she could possibly think of to keep Dawn under wraps, so to speak. Dr. Willow Rosenberg had written a VERY convincing note about why Dawn had to be excused for the rest of the school year. And the few friends that Dawn had made in school were very forgiving. Throughout her entire absence they did maintain contact with her either by telephone or the internet. The most surprising change to Dawn from eating Glory was revealed by her first sneezing spell. Dawn along with the others were surprised to learned that Dawn was now able to change her own appearance from her current super-tigress form to her previous fully human form AND a few others in between without the use of any witchy glamour.

Somehow by eating Glory, Dawn acquired her transformation ability! While Dawn had absolutely NO intention of ever eating Buffy, she enjoyed watching how much Buffy now sweat-ed around dinnertime every day. Eating Glory had filled the whole in her that had pained her and her appetite returned to normal. Well, as normal enough that a fully-grown tigress would have and Dawn had now permanently become a carnivore. With Willow gone along with her unlimited bank card, Buffy was forced to say, "No more tuna for you, little sister." Dawn had developed quite a taste for sushi that Buffy could no longer afford. It took Dawn a few months to master her transformation ability. However once she did learn how to control it, Buffy happily let her join in all her hunts.

A couple nights after Glory's demise while Dawn was still sleeping off eating her, Buffy was utterly thrilled to learn she had acquired a new ability. Apparently when Willow had succeeded in only returning Buffy to a feline-human hybrid, Willow hadn't de-clawed her. While cleaning out a nest of vampires Buffy swung her fist at one and when it leaned away from her Buffy tried stretching her arm a little further. SO she and the vampire were quite surprised when her fingernails suddenly shot out an extra 3 inches nicking its throat. Seizing on this new opportunity Buffy quickly swung at the vampire again this time cleanly severing its head. Buffy was lucky that everyone was so busy right then so she decided to keep this new surprise to herself. Buffy did secretly show her sister a few days later. Over time both Summers girls new abilities became lethally instinctive. It would be several years before they learned their children would inherit these capabilities.
1243212112212.title: Dawn's sniffles reveal a new surprise about...

12432121122121.content:
Aunt Tara spent all her time with Dawn while SHE spent the remainder of Spring and nearly all Summer perfecting both her new size-changing and shape-changing abilities. While Dawn did that, Buffy spent her days focusing on increasing the distance her newly enhanced finger-nails shot out when she wanted. She also learned over time that her sense of smell was also radically improving. So by the time Labor Day came around, Buffy greatly cheered Dawn up by inviting Dawn on her nightly patrol. Tara was stunned by how well the Summers sisters worked together on their first patrol. She was even more stunned when Buffy unveiled her new claws. They made short work of the pack of demons who had recently taken up residence in Sunnydale.

By Christmas, other than Spike all the vampires, demons and any other evil creatures living within 40 miles or so of Sunnydale had been dispatched. Shortly after the next vernal equinox, Dawn became a woman when her cycle began. Buffy felt it occur simultaneously with Dawn. Another one of Willow's "little" presents. Willow returned after hiding out for nearly a month, Buffy had totally cooled off about her accidentally feline hybridization. She thoroughly enjoyed the expressions Vampires gave her when she decapitated them with her finger-nails. To make things up with Tara, Willow had gone and done it again. This time it was a very powerful spell to synchronize their (Tara and Willow) monthly cycles. Unfortunately for all involved, Because she was the alpha female it ended up synchronizing all of them to Buffy's cycle, much to her great annoyment.

After bringing Dawn down from her unexpected feelings, the expression on Buffy's face reminded Willow that she needed to be somewhere else right away! In fact, Willow would've been exiled from the gang FOR GOOD if things the following month had worked out differently for the Summer's sisters. Because they now mystically shared their blood, when their next cycle occurred, something wholly unexpected and absolutely wonderful occurred. It happened while they were cleaning out a nest of Vampires and some very tall demon friends living near Lake Tahoe. When Dawn had focused on increasing her height to becoming 11 feet tall, Buffy AND Tara's bodies simultaneously duplicated her action. Once the nest was filled with just vampire dust and a few left-over demon bodies, Dawn returned everyone to their normal respective heights.



Although she was mystified by what had happened to her friends, Willow was much more miffed about being left out of the effect. It wasn't until years later when the Slayerettes had moved to Britain that Willow learned from the coven why she hadn't been effected by the spell. And boy was she really steamed about the reason. Unlike Tara, Willow hadn't been born with magic within her. Her magic had come to her by a different mechanism. To make things even more interesting, it turns out that because she was magically linked to Buffy as a sister slayer, Faith had also fully benefited from Willow's tampering with sexual magic.

A couple of months later, when Buffy and Dawn were in the area, they visited Faith in jail. When Faith recounted to Buffy the intensely violent, fulfilling and erotic dreams she had recently begun experiencing it didn't take Buffy long to figure out what was happening. Quickly recapping her new abilities Faith (out loud) said, "Boy, Buffy you sure have all the fun things happen to you. You know, I wish something like that would happen to me." A few minutes later, when Dawn started to demonstrate her new abilities they also fully happened to Faith and she fainted from joy. While they were at the prison, Buffy and Dawn dispatched a few minor demons that had been jailed there with Faith.

A couple years later right after Dawn graduated from High School, the Summers sisters took their show on the road. During Dawn's Senior year a new face had joined the gang, a boy who wasn't intimidated by Dawn's size or tail. He quietly tried to get her elected Homecoming Queen and DID ask her to the Junior/Senior prom. Dawn was reluctant to go but Buffy insisted that Dawn deserved to have that particular night away from patrolling. Buffy even said, "Don't worry about it Dawn. I'll make sure to save a few vampires or whatever we find for you to dust the next night." Curiously, Dawn and her date were voted best couple at the prom. And NO Willow didn't do anything magical to rig the vote.

One of the side-effects of being a living "mystical" key for Dawn was her increasing facility with all spoken human languages including math ( a language based on symbols). Her date was a history freak and they were literally made for each other. In fact they got along SO well at the prom, it wasn't long before he had totally surprised Dawn by proposing marriage to her. After he revived her and unsure of what to say, she asked him to wait for her answer which he gladly did. When she told Buffy and Aunt Tara they both insisted Dawn say yes immediately. She did and they married [appropriately enough] on the next Summer Solstice. Their father wasn't all that happy about his not yet 17 year-old younger daughter getting married but Buffy insisted he approve it or as she said, "You'll never see either of us alive again."

By the time that Buffy's 25th High School Reunion came around, the Western Hemisphere and all of Oceania were no longer infested with ANY Vampires and the demon population had also been severely reduced. It was then she decided to retire saying, "Well, I should leave some for Faith to take care of. Now that she's being paroled for good behavior I wouldn't want to take away ALL of her fun." And so she didn't. Then again Xander wouldn't wait forever. For although Buffy, Faith and oddly enough Tara were immortal, in a way, Xander and Willow were aging normally. Besides Dawn was going to be a grand-mother soon and they were all anxious to see how long her eldest daughter would be pregnant. Because she was now fully a blended feline-human all FIVE ! of Dawn's pregnancies had barely lasted 5 1/2 months.

Cordelia felt her body contort as Willow looked at her smiling evilly. The world seemed to be getting larger by the second, until everything stopped at mammoth size. She watched as Willow bent down, picked her up with one hand, and stuffed her into her purse.
